title: Brave New World (Unabridged) by Aldous Huxley
description:
One high quality .mp3 file from Audible.com

Narrator is Michael York. 

Remember in iTunes to change the info of this file to "Audiobook" and check the options to "remember position." This will allow you to keep your spot in the 8 hour track. 

Description:

When Lenina and Bernard visit a savage reservation, we experience how Utopia can destroy humanity.

On the 75th anniversary of its publication, this outstanding work of literature is more crucial and relevant today than ever before. Cloning, feel-good drugs, anti-aging programs, and total social control through politics, programming, and media: has Aldous Huxley accurately predicted our future? With a storyteller's genius, he weaves these ethical controversies in a compelling narrative that dawns in the year 632 A.F. (After Ford, the deity). When Lenina and Bernard visit a savage reservation, we experience how Utopia can destroy humanity.

ENJOY!!!
